1.title: William Wordsworth - The Prelude

episode of.title: Poetry: Between the Lines - The Romantics (TV Series 2015– )

1.plot: Hip-hop star Akala visits the landscapes of the Lake District and discusses with poet, Helen Mort how they inspired Wordsworth's poem 'The Prelude'. The Boat Stealing episode is discussed in detail to explore Wordsworth's attitudes to the awe-inspiring power of nature.

2.title: William Blake - London

episode of.title: Poetry: Between the Lines - The Romantics (TV Series 2015– )

2.plot: Hip-hop star Akala explores William Blake's poem 'London' and discusses how power and authority are abused to oppress the weakest in society. Everywhere Blake saw people who were oppressed and downtrodden. Akala discusses the poem and what it can tell us about the present day with poet and presenter, Mr Gee.

3.title: John Keats - Bright Star

episode of.title: Poetry: Between the Lines - The Romantics (TV Series 2015– )

3.plot: Hip-hop star Akala explores John Keats' poem 'Bright Star' with the poet Daljit Nagra. They discuss how the poem focuses on the transient nature of life and eternal nature of love. Young poets develop and respond to the poem's themes and emotions.

4.title: Percy Bysshe Shelley - Ozymandias

episode of.title: Poetry: Between the Lines - The Romantics (TV Series 2015– )

imdb.plot outline: Presented by hip-hop star Akala, Poetry: Between the Lines - The Romantics explores the poetry of the Romantic period through the work of Wordsworth, Byron, Blake, Shelley and Keats. Through a mix of animation, conversation and vignette, the film expresses classic Romantic themes, ranging from the power of nature to the effects of industrialisation. Akala discusses language, form and social context with a range of experts - from battle emcee Mark Grist to radio host Mr Gee - as well as some of Britain's most promising young poets. Through the fascination with love, loss, nature and politics, the programme shows how the concerns of the Romantics are still very much alive in the present-day world.
imdb.title: Poetry: Between the Lines - The Romantics

plot: Presented by hip-hop star Akala, _Poetry: Between the Lines - The Romantics_ (qv) explores the poetry of the Romantic period through the work of Wordsworth, Byron, Blake, Shelley and Keats. Through a mix of animation, conversation and vignette, the film expresses classic Romantic themes, ranging from the power of nature to the effects of industrialisation. Akala discusses language, form and social context with a range of experts - from battle emcee Mark Grist to radio host Mr Gee - as well as some of Britain's most promising young poets. Through the fascination with love, loss, nature and politics, the programme shows how the concerns of the Romantics are still very much alive in the present-day world.
